required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sucralfate to Improve Oral Intake in Children With Infectious Oral Ulcers: a Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Sucralfate to Improve Oral Intake in Children With Infectious Oral Ulcers: a Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if sucralfate, a medication commonly used for patients with stomach ulcers, may help pediatric patients with mouth ulcers decrease their pain level and improve their ability to drink.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Will quantify the amount (in ml/kg) of liquid ingested after intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants That Require Intravenous Fluid Administration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 hours from the time of enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: To explore the difference in the rates of intravenous fluid (IVF) administration in children treated with sucralfate versus placebo.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants That Require Admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 hours from the time of enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: To explore the difference in the rates admission rates in children treated with sucralfate versus placebo.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Unscheduled Visits
secondary_outcome.description: Will call families to find out about any unscheduled visits.

intervention.description: Will received placebo solution of similar quantity to that of the weight based dose of sucralfate.

All patients will receive analgesia, either acetaminophen 15mg/kg or ibuprofen 10mg/kg depending on medication administration prior to arrival in the Emergency Department and at the discretion of the treating physician, in addition to either the experimental drug or placebo.

All patients will receive analgesia, either acetaminophen 15mg/kg or ibuprofen 10mg/kg depending on medication administration prior to arrival in the Emergency Department and at the discretion of the treating physician, in addition to either the experimental drug or placebo.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥6 months and ≤5 years old
- Present with oral infectious ulcers such as gingivostomatitis, herpangina, or hand, foot and mouth disease
- History of decreased oral fluid intake by parent or guardian
- English or Spanish speaking parents or guardians
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severely dehydrated or toxic, requiring immediate resuscitation
- Exclusively breastfed
- Severe dental disease
- Significant mouth trauma
- Active Malignancy
- Preexisting upper airway obstruction or swallowing difficulties
- Received intravenous fluids within 24 hours
- Administration of BOTH acetaminophen AND ibuprofen prior to triage and within 4 hours of enrollment

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Experimental Group
group.description: Subjects will receive sucralfate Sucralfate: Will receive 20mg/kg/dose up to 1 gram. Acetaminophen: All patients will receive analgesia, either acetaminophen 15mg/kg or ibuprofen 10mg/kg depending on medication administration prior to arrival in the Emergency Department and at the discretion of the treating physician, in addition to either the experimental drug or placebo. Ibuprofen: All patients will receive analgesia, either acetaminophen 15mg/kg or ibuprofen 10mg/kg depending on medication administration prior to arrival in the Emergency Department and at the discretion of the treating physician, in addition to either the experimental drug or placebo.

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects will receive a placebo Placebo: Will received placebo solution of similar quantity to that of the weight based dose of sucralfate. Acetaminophen: All patients will receive analgesia, either acetaminophen 15mg/kg or ibuprofen 10mg/kg depending on medication administration prior to arrival in the Emergency Department and at the discretion of the treating physician, in addition to either the experimental drug or placebo. Ibuprofen: All patients will receive analgesia, either acetaminophen 15mg/kg or ibuprofen 10mg/kg depending on medication administration prior to arrival in the Emergency Department and at the discretion of the treating physician, in addition to either the experimental drug or placebo.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
